meanings.definition: Cooperate in a secret or unlawful way in order to deceive or gain an advantage over others.
meanings.sent1: The two students decided to collude on the test answers.
meanings.sent2: The criminals colluded to plan the robbery.
meanings.sent3: It was like a sneaky game when they colluded to cheat in the competition.
meanings.sent4: Their colluding shadows danced in the dimly lit alley.
meanings.sent5: The idea of colluding felt like a dark cloud hanging over them.

meanings.sent1: The group of friends colluded to surprise their friend on their birthday.
meanings.sent2: The villains colluded to overthrow the king.
meanings.sent3: The cats colluded to steal the fish from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The stars colluded in the night sky to create a beautiful constellation.
meanings.sent5: The wind and rain colluded to create a stormy night.
